name: infographic_rubric
description: Rubric for evaluating scientific paper infographics

dimensions.name: content_accuracy
dimensions.description: How accurately does the infographic represent the paper's findings and key concepts?
criteria: The infographic correctly represents the paper's main findings
Key concepts are accurately explained
No factual errors or misrepresentations
The level of detail is appropriate for the target audience

dimensions.name: visual_clarity
dimensions.description: How clear and understandable is the infographic?
criteria: Information is presented in a logical and intuitive way
Visual elements effectively communicate the intended message
Text is concise and easy to understand
The infographic can be understood without extensive prior knowledge

dimensions.name: design_quality
dimensions.description: How visually appealing and well-designed is the infographic?
criteria: The design is visually appealing and professional
Color choices enhance readability and understanding
Layout is balanced and makes good use of space
Typography is appropriate and enhances readability

dimensions.name: code_quality
dimensions.description: How well-written and maintainable is the React and D3 code?
criteria: Code is well-structured and follows best practices
Components are modular and reusable
Code is properly commented and documented
No obvious bugs or performance issues

dimensions.name: technical_implementation
dimensions.description: How well does the implementation use React and D3 features?
criteria: Appropriate use of React components and hooks
Effective use of D3 for data visualization
Responsive design that works on different screen sizes
Proper handling of data and state
